title: Introduction to zoomclass
text: category, High-level functions design analyse Zoom’s participants report (.csv file), especially checking student’s attendance Zoom classroom.

title: Introduction to zoomclass
text: term used “Zoom’s participant report”, basically, CSV log file host can downloaded Zoom meeting ended. contains following columns: Name (Original Name): show participant’s current name Zoom meeting optional original name last balanced parenthesis. User Email: email participant signed Zoom account Join Time: join time participants individual sessions Leave Time: leave time participants individual sessions Duration (Minutes): computed Leave Time - Join Time session Guest: “Yes” means person participants; “” means /host Recording Consent: “Y” means participant allowed recording zoom package comes example data Zoom’s participant report .csv use demo tutorial. Path example files can obtained following command.
code: # List all example data in `zoomclass` package zoomclass_example() #> [1] "participants_heroes_full.csv" "participants_heroes.csv"      #> [3] "zoom-chat-1.txt"              "zoom-chat-2.txt"  # Get a path to specific example data path_heroes <- zoomclass_example("participants_heroes.csv") path_heroes #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/zoomclass/extdata/participants_heroes.csv" system.file("extdata", package = "zoomclass") #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/zoomclass/extdata"

title: Introduction to zoomclass
text: read_participants() read data using readr::read_csv() performs followings steps: Read Zoom’s participant report tibble Clean column names, can manipulate easily R Apply appropriate time formatting (POSIXct) relevant columns Extract participant’s current (displayed) name original name Name Name_Original columns, respectively. output tibble zoom_participants subclass. metadata regarding Zoom meeting found, assigned meeting_overview attribute. can see, almost column names cleaned spaces; Join_Time Leave_Time formatted POSIXct object, correctly. Moreover, “015_Loki (Loki Laufeyson)” original Name (Original Name) column extracted “015_Loki” Name “Loki Laufeyson” Name_Original, respectively. output tibble pp_heroes contain sessions information participants. count names participants, can see rows duplicated. example, “Power Girl” 2 rows 2 sessions Zoom (join leave 2 times). Join_Time Leave_Time overlapped 2 sessions? might case ’s joined Zoom 2 devices time. show next, upcoming functions package can detect scenario.
code: pp_heroes <- read_participants(path_heroes)  str(pp_heroes) #> zoom_participants [31 × 9] (S3: zoom_participants/tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  $ Name (Original Name): chr [1:31] "015_Loki (Loki Laufeyson)" "019_Mockingbird" "014_Clea" "003_Power Girl (Kara Zor-L)" ... #>  $ Name                : chr [1:31] "015_Loki" "019_Mockingbird" "014_Clea" "003_Power Girl" ... #>  $ Name_Original       : chr [1:31] "Loki Laufeyson" NA NA "Kara Zor-L" ... #>  $ Email               : chr [1:31] "loki_asgardian@marvel.com" "mockingbird_human@marvel.com" "clea_unknown@marvel.com" "power-girl_kryptonian@dc.com" ... #>  $ Join_Time           : POSIXct[1:31], format: "2021-11-19 09:54:15" "2021-11-19 10:07:44" ... #>  $ Leave_Time          : POSIXct[1:31], format: "2021-11-19 12:01:59" "2021-11-19 12:01:58" ... #>  $ Duration_Minutes    : num [1:31] 128 115 10 114 52 114 113 113 112 112 ... #>  $ Guest               : chr [1:31] "Yes" "Yes" "No" "Yes" ... #>  $ Rec_Consent         : chr [1:31] "Y" "Y" NA "Y" ... library(dplyr) pp_heroes %>%    count(`Name (Original Name)`, sort = TRUE) %>%    head() #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   `Name (Original Name)`          n #>   <chr>                       <int> #> 1 003_Power Girl (Kara Zor-L)     2 #> 2 010_Cyborg Superman             2 #> 3 017_Swarm                       2 #> 4 022_Dazzler                     2 #> 5 001_Magus                       1 #> 6 002_She-Thing                   1 pp_heroes %>%    filter(Name == "003_Power Girl") %>%    select(Name, Email, Join_Time, Leave_Time, Duration_Minutes) #> # A tibble: 2 × 5 #>   Name           Email  Join_Time           Leave_Time          Duration_Minutes #>   <chr>          <chr>  <dttm>              <dttm>                         <dbl> #> 1 003_Power Girl power… 2021-11-19 10:08:26 2021-11-19 12:01:58              114 #> 2 003_Power Girl power… 2021-11-19 10:11:31 2021-11-19 12:01:58              111

title: Introduction to zoomclass
text: Now read Zoom’s participants data , ’s time analyse participants context classroom. now , ’ll call “participant” “student”. Next, 3 class_* functions introduced: class_session() summarizes time information individual sessions students (student multiple sessions, output show ≥ 1 rows per student) class_students() summarizes time information students (1 row per student) class_studentsID() summarizes time information student’s ID extracted student name (1 row per student’s ID) first argument functions receives input zoom_participants tibble created read_participants(). typical academic classroom usually explicit start end time. students arrive class later certain cutoff time point, teacher can mark late. class_* functions, must provide class_start class_end arguments used compute 4 time intervals student spent , , Zoom class: Before_Class: represent time interval student spent Zoom class started During_Class: represent time interval student spent Zoom class After_Class: represent time interval student spent Zoom class ended Total_Time: sum time Before_Class + During_Class + After_Class class_students() class_studentsID(), can compute late time period student providing late_cutoff argument. theses time intervals Period object lubridate package. (can converted hours, minutes, secound well.) Furthermore, class_* functions can tell whether students joined Zoom multiple devices time period. use case might live-exam conducted Zoom, want check students joined 1 device (cheating).

title: Introduction to zoomclass
text: Suppose Zoom classroom started 10:00 ended 12:00, call class_session() follows: (Input class_start class_end 24-hours clock time PM) previously stated, classroom-related time intervals computed. Let’s see spend time class time , may Loki cast illusion attend Zoom till end :-) Now, let’s see attend Zoom using multiple device time filter Multi_Device = TRUE. Session column displays session number student ranked Join_Time. Let’s see joined Zoom 1 time. can see, “Power Girl” “Swarm” session number = 2; however, aware two joined Zoom one time using 2 devices.
code: pp_heroes_session <-    class_session(pp_heroes,                  class_start = "10:00", # Official class started at 10:00 AM                 class_end = "12:00" # Official class ended at 12:00 PM                 )  pp_heroes_session #> # A tibble: 31 × 17 #>    `Name (Original Name)`  Name  Name_Original Email Session Class_Start         #>    <chr>                   <chr> <chr>         <chr>   <int> <dttm>              #>  1 001_Magus               001_… NA            magu…       1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #>  2 002_She-Thing           002_… NA            she-…       1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #>  3 003_Power Girl (Kara Z… 003_… Kara Zor-L    powe…       1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #>  4 003_Power Girl (Kara Z… 003_… Kara Zor-L    powe…       2 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #>  5 004_Angel Salvadore     004_… NA            ange…       1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #>  6 005_Donna Troy          005_… NA            donn…       1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #>  7 006_Phoenix             006_… NA            phoe…       1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #>  8 007_Birdman             007_… NA            bird…       1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #>  9 008_Simon Baz           008_… NA            simo…       1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> 10 009_Juggernaut (Cain M… 009_… Cain Marko    jugg…       1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> # … with 21 more rows, and 11 more variables: Class_End <dttm>, #> #   Join_Time <dttm>, Leave_Time <dttm>, Before_Class <Period>, #> #   During_Class <Period>, After_Class <Period>, Total_Time <Period>, #> #   Duration_Minutes <dbl>, Guest <chr>, Rec_Consent <chr>, Multi_Device <lgl> pp_heroes_session %>%    select(Name, ends_with("Class"), Total_Time) %>%    head() #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   Name                Before_Class During_Class After_Class Total_Time #>   <chr>               <Period>     <Period>     <Period>    <Period>   #> 1 001_Magus           NA           1H 15M 57S   1M 59S      1H 17M 56S #> 2 002_She-Thing       NA           22M 59S      1M 58S      24M 57S    #> 3 003_Power Girl      NA           1H 51M 34S   1M 58S      1H 53M 32S #> 4 003_Power Girl      NA           1H 48M 29S   1M 58S      1H 50M 27S #> 5 004_Angel Salvadore NA           1H 44M 49S   1M 58S      1H 46M 47S #> 6 005_Donna Troy      NA           1H 50M 34S   1M 55S      1H 52M 29S pp_heroes_session %>%    filter(During_Class == lubridate::hours(2)) %>%    select(Name, ends_with("Class")) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   Name     Before_Class During_Class After_Class #>   <chr>    <Period>     <Period>     <Period>    #> 1 015_Loki 5M 45S       2H 0M 0S     1M 59S pp_heroes_session %>%    filter(Multi_Device  == TRUE) %>%    select(Name, Session, Join_Time, Leave_Time, Multi_Device) #> # A tibble: 4 × 5 #>   Name           Session Join_Time           Leave_Time          Multi_Device #>   <chr>            <int> <dttm>              <dttm>              <lgl>        #> 1 003_Power Girl       1 2021-11-19 10:08:26 2021-11-19 12:01:58 TRUE         #> 2 003_Power Girl       2 2021-11-19 10:11:31 2021-11-19 12:01:58 TRUE         #> 3 017_Swarm            1 2021-11-19 10:14:30 2021-11-19 10:24:26 TRUE         #> 4 017_Swarm            2 2021-11-19 10:24:12 2021-11-19 12:01:58 TRUE pp_heroes_session %>%    filter(Session  > 1) %>%    select(Name, Session, Join_Time, Leave_Time, Multi_Device) #> # A tibble: 4 × 5 #>   Name              Session Join_Time           Leave_Time          Multi_Device #>   <chr>               <int> <dttm>              <dttm>              <lgl>        #> 1 003_Power Girl          2 2021-11-19 10:11:31 2021-11-19 12:01:58 TRUE         #> 2 010_Cyborg Super…       2 2021-11-19 11:28:11 2021-11-19 12:01:58 NA           #> 3 017_Swarm               2 2021-11-19 10:24:12 2021-11-19 12:01:58 TRUE         #> 4 022_Dazzler             2 2021-11-19 11:02:46 2021-11-19 11:29:38 NA

title: Introduction to zoomclass
text: class_students() summarizes time information grouped students (grouping variables Name (Original Name) Email). result tibble one row per student. columns output class_session(), except followings: Session_Count: show session counts student (many times student join leave class) First_Join_Time: student multiple sessions, choose earliest join time. Last_Leave_Time: student multiple sessions, choose latest leave time. New optional argument late_cutoff student considered late first joined time later cutoff. late time period shown Late_Time column. Let’s see joined class late > 10 minutes (later 10:25).
code: pp_heroes_students <-    class_students(pp_heroes,                 class_start = "10:00",                class_end = "12:00",                late_cutoff = "10:15" # If student joined later than 10:15 will considered late               )  head(pp_heroes_students) #> # A tibble: 6 × 16 #>   `Name (Original …` Name  Name_Original Email Session_Count Class_Start         #>   <chr>              <chr> <chr>         <chr>         <int> <dttm>              #> 1 001_Magus          001_… NA            magu…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> 2 002_She-Thing      002_… NA            she-…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> 3 003_Power Girl (K… 003_… Kara Zor-L    powe…             2 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> 4 004_Angel Salvado… 004_… NA            ange…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> 5 005_Donna Troy     005_… NA            donn…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> 6 006_Phoenix        006_… NA            phoe…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> # … with 10 more variables: Class_End <dttm>, First_Join_Time <dttm>, #> #   Last_Leave_Time <dttm>, Before_Class <Period>, During_Class <Period>, #> #   After_Class <Period>, Total_Time <Period>, Duration_Minutes <dbl>, #> #   Multi_Device <lgl>, Late_Time <Period> pp_heroes_students %>%    filter(Late_Time > lubridate::minutes(10)) %>%    select(Name, First_Join_Time, Late_Time) #> # A tibble: 5 × 3 #>   Name               First_Join_Time     Late_Time #>   <chr>              <dttm>              <Period>  #> 1 001_Magus          2021-11-19 10:44:03 29M 3S    #> 2 002_She-Thing      2021-11-19 11:37:01 1H 22M 1S #> 3 012_Shang-Chi      2021-11-19 11:18:16 1H 3M 16S #> 4 021_Winter Soldier 2021-11-19 11:00:49 45M 49S   #> 5 022_Dazzler        2021-11-19 11:01:02 46M 2S

title: Introduction to zoomclass
text: Supposed ’ve checked class attendance student, perhaps want merge data database key columns usually student’s ID. First, informed students put student’s ID names, example: “001_Megus”. class_studentsID() help summarizes time information grouped student’s ID. , can used IDs merge database. internal processes class_studentsID() extracts student’s ID Name (Original Name) column using regular expression provided id_regex. , time information summarized per student’s ID (grouping variable ID), rest output columns similar class_students(). Finally, result tibble one row per ID. (ID founded multiple names (e.g. “001_Magus”, “001_magus”), Name column contain combinations names particular ID.)
code: pp_heroes_studentsID <-    class_studentsID(pp_heroes,                     id_regex = "\\d+", # Extract digits from student name as student's ID                    class_start = "10:00",                    class_end = "12:00",                    late_cutoff = "10:15" # If student joined later than 10:15 will considered late                    )  head(pp_heroes_studentsID) #> # A tibble: 6 × 15 #>   ID    Name         Email Session_Count Class_Start         Class_End           #>   <chr> <chr>        <chr>         <int> <dttm>              <dttm>              #> 1 001   001_Magus    magu…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 2021-11-19 12:00:00 #> 2 002   002_She-Thi… she-…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 2021-11-19 12:00:00 #> 3 003   003_Power G… powe…             2 2021-11-19 10:00:00 2021-11-19 12:00:00 #> 4 004   004_Angel S… ange…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 2021-11-19 12:00:00 #> 5 005   005_Donna T… donn…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 2021-11-19 12:00:00 #> 6 006   006_Phoenix  phoe…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 2021-11-19 12:00:00 #> # … with 9 more variables: First_Join_Time <dttm>, Last_Leave_Time <dttm>, #> #   Before_Class <Period>, During_Class <Period>, After_Class <Period>, #> #   Total_Time <Period>, Duration_Minutes <dbl>, Multi_Device <lgl>, #> #   Late_Time <Period>

title: Introduction to zoomclass
text: , give example merging student data database. package provides heroes_students data frame contain names ID student enrolled course semester. can join heroes_students pp_heroes_studentsID using dplyr::*_join functions ID.
code: head(heroes_students) #>    ID            Name Comment #> 1 001           Magus    <NA> #> 2 004 Angel Salvadore    <NA> #> 3 005      Donna Troy    <NA> #> 4 006         Phoenix    <NA> #> 5 008       Simon Baz    <NA> #> 6 009      Juggernaut    <NA>

previous_headings: Participants Report > Classroom in Zoom > Merge Data
what: Check Students NOT in Zoom Class
title: Introduction to zoomclass
text: check whether students joined Zoom class room , can obtained using filtering join function: dplyr::anti_join(). students heroes_students data frame, pp_heroes_studentsID, means didn’t join Zoom classroom.
code: heroes_students %>%    anti_join(pp_heroes_studentsID, by = "ID") #>    ID         Name               Comment #> 1 031      Impulse                  <NA> #> 2 032  Marvel Girl    on a space mission #> 3 033      Giganta                  <NA> #> 4 034       Vision last seen in Westview #> 5 036 Silk Spectre                  <NA>

previous_headings: Participants Report > Classroom in Zoom > Merge Data
title: Introduction to zoomclass
text: Likewise, can also check participants joined Zoom classroom heroes_students data frame (non-students). , dplyr::anti_join() can used.
code: pp_heroes_studentsID %>%    anti_join(heroes_students, by = "ID") #> # A tibble: 5 × 15 #>   ID    Name         Email Session_Count Class_Start         Class_End           #>   <chr> <chr>        <chr>         <int> <dttm>              <dttm>              #> 1 002   002_She-Thi… she-…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 2021-11-19 12:00:00 #> 2 003   003_Power G… powe…             2 2021-11-19 10:00:00 2021-11-19 12:00:00 #> 3 007   007_Birdman  bird…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 2021-11-19 12:00:00 #> 4 013   013_Thunder… thun…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 2021-11-19 12:00:00 #> 5 018   018_Blizzar… bliz…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 2021-11-19 12:00:00 #> # … with 9 more variables: First_Join_Time <dttm>, Last_Leave_Time <dttm>, #> #   Before_Class <Period>, During_Class <Period>, After_Class <Period>, #> #   Total_Time <Period>, Duration_Minutes <dbl>, Multi_Device <lgl>, #> #   Late_Time <Period>

previous_headings: Participants Report > Classroom in Zoom > Merge Data
title: Introduction to zoomclass
text: dplyr::full_join() mutating join function merge 2 data frame without rows lost either one. example, fully joined 2 data frame pp_heroes_studentsID heroes_students ID. Suffix "_from_ID" "_from_Zoom" represents unmatched rows list students (heroes_students) Zoom classroom, respectively. Student didn’t joined Zoom classroom NA presented Name_from_Zoom column, whereas participants joined Zoom classroom list students NA presented Name_from_ID column.
code: # Merge to Zoom data by `ID` heroes_students_joined <- heroes_students %>%    full_join(pp_heroes_studentsID, by = "ID", suffix = c("_from_ID", "_from_Zoom")) %>%    relocate(ID, starts_with("Name"))  head(heroes_students_joined) #>    ID    Name_from_ID              Name_from_Zoom Comment #> 1 001           Magus                   001_Magus    <NA> #> 2 004 Angel Salvadore         004_Angel Salvadore    <NA> #> 3 005      Donna Troy              005_Donna Troy    <NA> #> 4 006         Phoenix                 006_Phoenix    <NA> #> 5 008       Simon Baz               008_Simon Baz    <NA> #> 6 009      Juggernaut 009_Juggernaut (Cain Marko)    <NA> #>                                Email Session_Count         Class_Start #> 1           magus_unknown@marvel.com             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> 2 angel-salvadore_unknown@marvel.com             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> 3           donna-troy_amazon@dc.com             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> 4          phoenix_mutant@marvel.com             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> 5             simon-baz_human@dc.com             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> 6        juggernaut_human@marvel.com             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #>             Class_End     First_Join_Time     Last_Leave_Time Before_Class #> 1 2021-11-19 12:00:00 2021-11-19 10:44:03 2021-11-19 12:01:59         <NA> #> 2 2021-11-19 12:00:00 2021-11-19 10:15:11 2021-11-19 12:01:58         <NA> #> 3 2021-11-19 12:00:00 2021-11-19 10:09:26 2021-11-19 12:01:55         <NA> #> 4 2021-11-19 12:00:00 2021-11-19 10:19:40 2021-11-19 12:01:54         <NA> #> 5 2021-11-19 12:00:00 2021-11-19 10:11:26 2021-11-19 12:01:59         <NA> #> 6 2021-11-19 12:00:00 2021-11-19 10:10:49 2021-11-19 12:01:56         <NA> #>   During_Class After_Class Total_Time Duration_Minutes Multi_Device Late_Time #> 1   1H 15M 57S      1M 59S 1H 17M 56S               78           NA    29M 3S #> 2   1H 44M 49S      1M 58S 1H 46M 47S              107           NA       11S #> 3   1H 50M 34S      1M 55S 1H 52M 29S              113           NA      <NA> #> 4   1H 40M 20S      1M 54S 1H 42M 14S              103           NA    4M 40S #> 5   1H 48M 34S      1M 59S 1H 50M 33S              111           NA      <NA> #> 6   1H 49M 11S      1M 56S  1H 51M 7S              112           NA      <NA> heroes_students_joined %>%    filter(if_any(starts_with("Name"), is.na)) %>%    select(ID, starts_with("Name"), Comment) #>     ID Name_from_ID              Name_from_Zoom               Comment #> 1  031      Impulse                        <NA>                  <NA> #> 2  032  Marvel Girl                        <NA>    on a space mission #> 3  033      Giganta                        <NA>                  <NA> #> 4  034       Vision                        <NA> last seen in Westview #> 5  036 Silk Spectre                        <NA>                  <NA> #> 6  002         <NA>               002_She-Thing                  <NA> #> 7  003         <NA> 003_Power Girl (Kara Zor-L)                  <NA> #> 8  007         <NA>                 007_Birdman                  <NA> #> 9  013         <NA>          013_Thunderbird II                  <NA> #> 10 018         <NA>             018_Blizzard II                  <NA>

title: Introduction to zoomclass
text: final functions package design parse program Zoom chat file .txt file tibble. j Raw zoom-chat-1.txt looks like . Use read_zoom_chat() read data frame. Last updated: 2022-04-02
code: # Path to example Zoom Chat file path <- zoomclass_example("zoom-chat-1.txt") readLines(path) %>%    glue::as_glue() #> 01:07:16 Tom:    Hi everyone #> 01:09:00 Anny:   Hello Tom! #> 01:10:30 Max:    Do you have a good weekend? #> 01:11:10 Anny:   Yes we do. #> 01:11:34 Jenny:  It's great :) #> 01:17:15 Max:    I wish I could be there. #> 01:18:14 Anny:   Come and join us next time. #> 01:19:42 Max:    Sure, I will. # Read from Text to a Data Frame read_zoom_chat(path) #> # A tibble: 8 × 3 #>   Time     Name  Content                     #>   <chr>    <chr> <chr>                       #> 1 01:07:16 Tom   Hi everyone                 #> 2 01:09:00 Anny  Hello Tom!                  #> 3 01:10:30 Max   Do you have a good weekend? #> 4 01:11:10 Anny  Yes we do.                  #> 5 01:11:34 Jenny It's great :)               #> 6 01:17:15 Max   I wish I could be there.    #> 7 01:18:14 Anny  Come and join us next time. #> 8 01:19:42 Max   Sure, I will.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kittipos Sirivongrungson. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Sirivongrungson K (2022). zoomclass: Zoom Class. R package version 0.1.1, https://lightbridge-ks.github.io/zoomclass.
code: @Manual{,   title = {zoomclass: Zoom Class},   author = {Kittipos Sirivongrungson},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.1},   url = {https://lightbridge-ks.github.io/zoomclass}, }

title: Zoom Class
text: high-level data analysis R package Zoom’s participants report .csv Zoom’s chat .txt file.

title: Zoom Class
text: can install development version GitHub : {zoomclass} aims analyse Zoom participants reports Zoom chat files.
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("Lightbridge-KS/zoomclass")

title: Zoom Class
text: Functions category constructed perform analysis Zoom’s participants report .csv setting online-classroom using Zoom. Student’s time information time spent , , class computed, also time period students joined classroom late can also computed. First, read data Zoom’s participants report .csv data frame using read_participants(), execute classroom analysis one class_*() functions. 3 main class_*() functions. class_session() summarizes time information individual sessions students (student multiple sessions, output show ≥ 1 rows per student) class_students() summarizes time information students (1 row per student) class_studentsID() summarizes time information student’s ID extracted student name (1 row per student’s ID)

title: Zoom Class
text: read_zoom_chat() can used parse program Zoom chat file .txt file tibble, just execute followings:
code: library(zoomclass) # Path to example Zoom Chat file as plain text path <- zoomclass_example("zoom-chat-1.txt") # Read from Text to Data Frame read_zoom_chat(path) #> # A tibble: 8 × 3 #>   Time     Name  Content                     #>   <chr>    <chr> <chr>                       #> 1 01:07:16 Tom   Hi everyone                 #> 2 01:09:00 Anny  Hello Tom!                  #> 3 01:10:30 Max   Do you have a good weekend? #> 4 01:11:10 Anny  Yes we do.                  #> 5 01:11:34 Jenny It's great :)               #> 6 01:17:15 Max   I wish I could be there.    #> 7 01:18:14 Anny  Come and join us next time. #> 8 01:19:42 Max   Sure, I will.

title: Zoom Class
text: Get started zoomclass Last updated: 2022-04-02

title: Class Overview — class_overview
text: Retrieve overview class room information time class started, ended, late time cutoff.

title: Class Overview — class_overview
code: class_overview(data)

title: Class Overview — class_overview
text: data "zoom_class" object

title: Class Overview — class_overview
text: "class_overview" attributes: tibble following column names: "class_start", "class_end", "late_cutoff"

title: Zoom Class Session Summary — class_session
text: class_session() designed retrieve time information student's session Zoom's classroom given time period. Input function (data) zoom_participants object returned read_participants().

title: Zoom Class Session Summary — class_session
code: class_session(   data,   class_start = NULL,   class_end = NULL,   arrange_by = c("Join_Time", "Name", "None"),   arrange_group = c("Name-Email", "Session", "None"),   period_to = c("period", "second", "minute", "hour"),   round_digits = NULL )

title: Zoom Class Session Summary — class_session
text: data data frame (tibble) class zoom_participants class_start (Character) time class started, input "hh:mm:ss" "hh:mm". NULL (default) zoom_participants meeting_overview attribute, "Start_Time" attribute used. class_end (Character) time class ended, input "hh:mm:ss" "hh:mm". NULL (default) zoom_participants meeting_overview attribute, "End_Time" attribute used. arrange_by (Character) arrange rows, must one : "Join_Time": arrange Join_Time, earliest first "Name": arrange Name (Original Name) "None": arrange, preserve rows original Zoom's participant file arrange_group (Character) Indicate group arrange_by affected. "Name-Email": group Name (Original Name) Email "Session": group Session "None": grouping variable period_to (Character) Indicate units "Before_Class", "During_Class", "After_Class" "Total_Time" output. Must one : "period" (default): return lubridate::period object "second": return seconds (numeric) "minute": return minute (numeric) "hour": return hour (numeric) round_digits (Integer) significant digits round numeric columns. NULL (default), round.

title: Zoom Class Session Summary — class_session
text: data frame (tibble) class zoom_class. following columns: "Name (Original Name)": column "Name (Original Name)" input file "Name": Current name displayed Zoom meeting participants. "Name_Original": Original name participants. extracted contents within last balanced parentheses "Name (Original Name)". "Email": original "User Email" column "Session": Indicate active session(s) Zoom students. Computed ranking "Join_Time" grouping variables: "Name (Original Name)" "Email". "Class_Start" (POSIXct): Compute date "Join_Time" time specified class_start argument. "Class_End" (POSIXct): Compute date "Leave_Time" time specified class_end argument. "Join_Time": original "Join Time" column "Leave_Time": original "Leave Time" column "Before_Class": Time spent class_start session. "During_Class": Time spent class (class_start class_end) session. "After_Class": Time spent class_end session. "Total_Time": "Before_Class" + "During_Class" + "After_Class" "Duration_Minutes": original "Duration (Minutes)" column "Rec_Consent": original "Recording Consent" column "Multi_Device": TRUE sessions student joined Zoom multiple devices. computed checking whether "Join_Time" "Leave_Time" overlapped sessions within students. Otherwise, NA returned way certain students joined single device.

title: Zoom Class Session Summary — class_session
text: providing time class started (class_start) ended (class_end), function compute time spent , , class sessions. student joined classroom using multiple device, TRUE placed "Multi_Device" column output. output displayed one row per session student. (e.g., student "" joined one time, multiple rows ""). Finally, rows arranged specified arrange_by grouping arrange_group.

title: Zoom Class Students Summary — class_students
text: data frame (tibble) class zoom_class. following columns: "Name (Original Name)": column "Name (Original Name)" input file "Name": Current name displayed Zoom meeting participants. "Name_Original": Original name participants. extracted contents within last balanced parentheses "Name (Original Name)". "Email": original "User Email" column "Session_Count": Show counts many session students joined leaved Zoom class. "Class_Start" (POSIXct): Compute date "Join_Time" time specified class_start argument. "Class_End" (POSIXct): Compute date "Leave_Time" time specified class_end argument. "First_Join_Time": First join time students "Last_Leave_Time": Last leave time students "Before_Class": Time spent class_start student. "During_Class": Time spent class (class_start class_end) student. "After_Class": Time spent class_end student. "Total_Time": "Before_Class" + "During_Class" + "After_Class" "Duration_Minutes": Sum "Duration (Minutes)" students. Notice: Total_Time likely less original Duration_Minutes latter round decimal . difference pronounced summed multiple sessions. "Multi_Device": TRUE students joined Zoom multiple devices session. "Late_Time" (Optional): provide late_cutoff "hh:mm:ss", "Late_Time" period computed Join_Time - late_cutoff.

title: Zoom Class Students Summary — class_students
text: providing time class started (class_start) ended (class_end), function compute time spent , , class students. Furthermore, Late time period can calculated students joined Zoom class later certain cutoff time (late_cutoff). students joined classroom using multiple device sessions, TRUE placed "Multi_Device" column output. result displayed one row per student. "Session_Count" counts many times students join leave Zoom class.

"Total_Time": "Before_Class" + "During_Class" + "After_Class" "Duration_Minutes": Sum "Duration (Minutes)" students. Notice: Total_Time likely less original Duration_Minutes latter round decimal . difference pronounced summed multiple sessions. "Multi_Device": TRUE students joined Zoom multiple devices session. "Late_Time" (Optional): provide late_cutoff "hh:mm:ss", "Late_Time" period computed Join_Time - late_cutoff.

title: Zoom Class Students ID Summary — class_studentsID
text: Firstly, student's ID extracted "Name (Original Name)" column using regular expression provided id_regex new "ID" column. "ID" column used groping variable represents students. "Name" "Email" column output combination (IDs) "Name (Original Name)" "Email", respectively. providing time class started (class_start) ended (class_end), function compute time spent , , class students (ID). Furthermore, Late time period can calculated students joined Zoom class later certain cutoff time (late_cutoff). students joined classroom using multiple device sessions, TRUE placed "Multi_Device" column output. result displayed one row per student's ID. "Session_Count" counts many times students join leave Zoom class.
